80  /**
81   * Provides basic authorization checks for data access and administrative
82   * operations.
83   *
84   * <p>
85   * {@code AccessController} performs authorization checks for HBase operations
86   * based on:
87   * <ul>
88   *   <li>the identity of the user performing the operation</li>
89   *   <li>the scope over which the operation is performed, in increasing
90   *   specificity: global, table, column family, or qualifier</li>
91   *   <li>the type of action being performed (as mapped to
92   *   {@link Permission.Action} values)</li>
93   * </ul>
94   * If the authorization check fails, an {@link AccessDeniedException}
95   * will be thrown for the operation.
96   * </p>
97   *
98   * <p>
99   * To perform authorization checks, {@code AccessController} relies on the
100  * {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.SecureRpcEngine} being loaded to provide
101  * the user identities for remote requests.
102  * </p>
103  *
104  * <p>
105  * The access control lists used for authorization can be manipulated via the
106  * exposed {@link AccessControllerProtocol} implementation, and the associated
107  * {@code grant}, {@code revoke}, and {@code user_permission} HBase shell
108  * commands.
109  * </p>
110  */
111 public class AccessController extends BaseRegionObserver
112     implements MasterObserver, RegionServerObserver, AccessControllerProtocol {
113   public static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(AccessController.class);
114 
115   private static final Log AUDITLOG =
116     LogFactory.getLog("SecurityLogger."+AccessController.class.getName());
117

119    * Version number for AccessControllerProtocol

136   void initialize(RegionCoprocessorEnvironment e) throws IOException {
137     final HRegion region = e.getRegion();
138 
139     Map<byte[],ListMultimap<String,TablePermission>> tables =
140         AccessControlLists.loadAll(region);
141     // For each table, write out the table's permissions to the respective
142     // znode for that table.
143     for (Map.Entry<byte[],ListMultimap<String,TablePermission>> t:
144       tables.entrySet()) {
145       byte[] table = t.getKey();
146       ListMultimap<String,TablePermission> perms = t.getValue();
147       byte[] serialized = AccessControlLists.writePermissionsAsBytes(perms,
148           regionEnv.getConfiguration());
149       this.authManager.getZKPermissionWatcher().writeToZookeeper(table, serialized);
150     }
151   }
152 
153   /**
154    * Writes all table ACLs for the tables in the given Map up into ZooKeeper
155    * znodes.  This is called to synchronize ACL changes following {@code _acl_}
156    * table updates.
157    */
158   void updateACL(RegionCoprocessorEnvironment e,
159       final Map<byte[], List<KeyValue>> familyMap) {
160     Set<byte[]> tableSet = new TreeSet<byte[]>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
161     for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<KeyValue>> f : familyMap.entrySet()) {
162       List<KeyValue> kvs = f.getValue();
163       for (KeyValue kv: kvs) {
164         if (Bytes.equals(kv.getBuffer(), kv.getFamilyOffset(),
165             kv.getFamilyLength(), AccessControlLists.ACL_LIST_FAMILY, 0,
166             AccessControlLists.ACL_LIST_FAMILY.length)) {
167           tableSet.add(kv.getRow());
168         }
169       }
170     }
171 
172     ZKPermissionWatcher zkw = this.authManager.getZKPermissionWatcher();
173     Configuration conf = regionEnv.getConfiguration();
174     for (byte[] tableName: tableSet) {
175       try {
176         ListMultimap<String,TablePermission> perms =
177           AccessControlLists.getTablePermissions(conf, tableName);
178         byte[] serialized = AccessControlLists.writePermissionsAsBytes(perms, conf);
179         zkw.writeToZookeeper(tableName, serialized);
180       } catch (IOException ex) {
181         LOG.error("Failed updating permissions mirror for '" + tableName + "'", ex);
182       }
183     }
184   }
185 
186   /**
187    * Check the current user for authorization to perform a specific action
188    * against the given set of row data.
189    *
190    * <p>Note: Ordering of the authorization checks
191    * has been carefully optimized to short-circuit the most common requests
192    * and minimize the amount of processing required.</p>
193    *
194    * @param permRequest the action being requested
195    * @param e the coprocessor environment
196    * @param families the map of column families to qualifiers present in
197    * the request
198    * @return
199    */
200   AuthResult permissionGranted(String request, User user, TablePermission.Action permRequest,
201       RegionCoprocessorEnvironment e,
202       Map<byte [], ? extends Collection<?>> families) {
203     HRegionInfo hri = e.getRegion().getRegionInfo();
204     byte[] tableName = hri.getTableName();
205 
206     // 1. All users need read access to .META. and -ROOT- tables.
207     // this is a very common operation, so deal with it quickly.
208     if (hri.isRootRegion() || hri.isMetaRegion()) {
209       if (permRequest == TablePermission.Action.READ) {
210         return AuthResult.allow(request, "All users allowed", user,
211           permRequest, tableName, families);
212       }
213     }
214 
215     if (user == null) {
216       return AuthResult.deny(request, "No user associated with request!", null,
217         permRequest, tableName, families);
218     }
219 
220     // Users with CREATE/ADMIN rights need to modify .META. and _acl_ table
221     // e.g. When a new table is created a new entry in .META. is added,
222     // so the user need to be allowed to write on it.
223     // e.g. When a table is removed an entry is removed from .META. and _acl_
224     // and the user need to be allowed to write on both tables.
225     if (permRequest == TablePermission.Action.WRITE &&
226        (hri.isRootRegion() || hri.isMetaRegion() ||
227         Bytes.equals(tableName, AccessControlLists.ACL_GLOBAL_NAME)) &&
228        (authManager.authorize(user, Permission.Action.CREATE) ||
229         authManager.authorize(user, Permission.Action.ADMIN)))
230     {
231        return AuthResult.allow(request, "Table permission granted", user,
232         permRequest, tableName, families);
233     }
234 
235     // 2. check for the table-level, if successful we can short-circuit
236     if (authManager.authorize(user, tableName, (byte[])null, permRequest)) {
237       return AuthResult.allow(request, "Table permission granted", user,
238         permRequest, tableName, families);
239     }
240 
241     // 3. check permissions against the requested families
242     if (families != null && families.size() > 0) {
243       // all families must pass
244       for (Map.Entry<byte [], ? extends Collection<?>> family : families.entrySet()) {
245         // a) check for family level access
246         if (authManager.authorize(user, tableName, family.getKey(),
247             permRequest)) {
248           continue;  // family-level permission overrides per-qualifier
249         }
250 
251         // b) qualifier level access can still succeed
252         if ((family.getValue() != null) && (family.getValue().size() > 0)) {
253           if (family.getValue() instanceof Set) {
254             // for each qualifier of the family
255             Set<byte[]> familySet = (Set<byte[]>)family.getValue();
256             for (byte[] qualifier : familySet) {
257               if (!authManager.authorize(user, tableName, family.getKey(),
258                                          qualifier, permRequest)) {
259                 return AuthResult.deny(request, "Failed qualifier check", user,
260                     permRequest, tableName, makeFamilyMap(family.getKey(), qualifier));
261               }
262             }
263           } else if (family.getValue() instanceof List) { // List<KeyValue>
264             List<KeyValue> kvList = (List<KeyValue>)family.getValue();
265             for (KeyValue kv : kvList) {
266               if (!authManager.authorize(user, tableName, family.getKey(),
267                       kv.getQualifier(), permRequest)) {
268                 return AuthResult.deny(request, "Failed qualifier check", user,
269                     permRequest, tableName, makeFamilyMap(family.getKey(), kv.getQualifier()));
270               }
271             }
272           }
273         } else {
274           // no qualifiers and family-level check already failed
275           return AuthResult.deny(request, "Failed family check", user, permRequest,
276               tableName, makeFamilyMap(family.getKey(), null));
277         }
278       }
279 
280       // all family checks passed
281       return AuthResult.allow(request, "All family checks passed", user, permRequest,
282           tableName, families);
283     }
284 
285     // 4. no families to check and table level access failed
286     return AuthResult.deny(request, "No families to check and table permission failed",
287         user, permRequest, tableName, families);
288   }
289 
290   private void logResult(AuthResult result) {
291     if (AUDITLOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
292       RequestContext ctx = RequestContext.get();
293       InetAddress remoteAddr = null;
294       if (ctx != null) {
295         remoteAddr = ctx.getRemoteAddress();
296       }
297       AUDITLOG.trace("Access " + (result.isAllowed() ? "allowed" : "denied") +
298           " for user " + (result.getUser() != null ? result.getUser().getShortName() : "UNKNOWN") +
299           "; reason: " + result.getReason() +
300           "; remote address: " + (remoteAddr != null ? remoteAddr : "") +
301           "; request: " + result.getRequest() +
302           "; context: " + result.toContextString());
303     }
304   }
305 
306   /**
307    * Returns the active user to which authorization checks should be applied.
308    * If we are in the context of an RPC call, the remote user is used,
309    * otherwise the currently logged in user is used.
310    */
311   private User getActiveUser() throws IOException {
312     User user = RequestContext.getRequestUser();
313     if (!RequestContext.isInRequestContext()) {
314       // for non-rpc handling, fallback to system user
315       user = User.getCurrent();
316     }
317 
318     return user;
319   }
320 
321   /**
322    * Authorizes that the current user has any of the given permissions for the
323    * given table, column family and column qualifier.
324    * @param tableName Table requested
325    * @param family Column family requested
326    * @param qualifier Column qualifier requested
327    * @throws IOException if obtaining the current user fails
328    * @throws AccessDeniedException if user has no authorization
329    */
330   private void requirePermission(String request, byte[] tableName, byte[] family, byte[] qualifier,
331       Action... permissions) throws IOException {
332     User user = getActiveUser();
333     AuthResult result = null;
334 
335     for (Action permission : permissions) {
336       if (authManager.authorize(user, tableName, family, qualifier, permission)) {
337         result = AuthResult.allow(request, "Table permission granted", user,
338                                   permission, tableName, family, qualifier);
339         break;
340       } else {
341         // rest of the world
342         result = AuthResult.deny(request, "Insufficient permissions", user,
343                                  permission, tableName, family, qualifier);
344       }
345     }
346     logResult(result);
347     if (!result.isAllowed()) {
348       throw new AccessDeniedException("Insufficient permissions " + result.toContextString());
349     }
350   }
351 
352   /**
353    * Authorizes that the current user has global privileges for the given action.
354    * @param perm The action being requested
355    * @throws IOException if obtaining the current user fails
356    * @throws AccessDeniedException if authorization is denied
357    */
358   private void requirePermission(String request, Permission.Action perm) throws IOException {
359     requireGlobalPermission(request, perm, null, null);
360   }
361 
362   /**
363    * Authorizes that the current user has permission to perform the given
364    * action on the set of table column families.
365    * @param perm Action that is required
366    * @param env The current coprocessor environment
367    * @param families The map of column families-qualifiers.
368    * @throws AccessDeniedException if the authorization check failed
369    */
370   public void requirePermission(String request, Permission.Action perm,
371         RegionCoprocessorEnvironment env,
372         Map<byte[], ? extends Collection<?>> families)
373       throws IOException {
374     User user = getActiveUser();
375     AuthResult result = permissionGranted(request, user, perm, env, families);
376     logResult(result);
377 
378     if (!result.isAllowed()) {
379       throw new AccessDeniedException("Insufficient permissions (table=" +
380         env.getRegion().getTableDesc().getNameAsString()+
381         ((families != null && families.size() > 0) ? ", family: " +
382         result.toFamilyString() : "") + ", action=" +
383         perm.toString() + ")");
384     }
385   }
386 
387    /**
388    * Checks that the user has the given global permission. The generated
389    * audit log message will contain context information for the operation
390    * being authorized, based on the given parameters.
391    * @param perm Action being requested
392    * @param tableName Affected table name.
393    * @param familiMap Affected column families.
394    */
395   private void requireGlobalPermission(String request, Permission.Action perm, byte[] tableName,
396       Map<byte[], ? extends Collection<byte[]>> familyMap) throws IOException {
397     User user = getActiveUser();
398     if (authManager.authorize(user, perm)) {
399       logResult(AuthResult.allow(request, "Global check allowed", user, perm, tableName, familyMap));
400     } else {
401       logResult(AuthResult.deny(request, "Global check failed", user, perm, tableName, familyMap));
402       throw new AccessDeniedException("Insufficient permissions for user '" +
403           (user != null ? user.getShortName() : "null") +"' (global, action=" +
404           perm.toString() + ")");
405     }
406   }
407 
408   /**
409    * Returns <code>true</code> if the current user is allowed the given action
410    * over at least one of the column qualifiers in the given column families.
411    */
412   private boolean hasFamilyQualifierPermission(User user,
413       TablePermission.Action perm,
414       RegionCoprocessorEnvironment env,
415       Map<byte[], ? extends Set<byte[]>> familyMap)
416     throws IOException {
417     HRegionInfo hri = env.getRegion().getRegionInfo();
418     byte[] tableName = hri.getTableName();
419 
420     if (user == null) {
421       return false;
422     }
423 
424     if (familyMap != null && familyMap.size() > 0) {
425       // at least one family must be allowed
426       for (Map.Entry<byte[], ? extends Set<byte[]>> family :
427           familyMap.entrySet()) {
428         if (family.getValue() != null && !family.getValue().isEmpty()) {
429           for (byte[] qualifier : family.getValue()) {
430             if (authManager.matchPermission(user, tableName,
431                 family.getKey(), qualifier, perm)) {
432               return true;
433             }
434           }
435         } else {
436           if (authManager.matchPermission(user, tableName, family.getKey(),
437               perm)) {
438             return true;
439           }
440         }
441       }
442     } else if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
443       LOG.debug("Empty family map passed for permission check");
444     }
445 
446     return false;
447   }

449   /* ---- MasterObserver implementation ---- */
450   public void start(CoprocessorEnvironment env) throws IOException {
451 
452     ZooKeeperWatcher zk = null;
453     if (env instanceof MasterCoprocessorEnvironment) {
454       // if running on HMaster
455       MasterCoprocessorEnvironment mEnv = (MasterCoprocessorEnvironment) env;
456       zk = mEnv.getMasterServices().getZooKeeper();      
457     } else if (env instanceof RegionServerCoprocessorEnvironment) {      
458       RegionServerCoprocessorEnvironment rsEnv = (RegionServerCoprocessorEnvironment) env;
459       zk = rsEnv.getRegionServerServices().getZooKeeper();      
460     } else if (env instanceof RegionCoprocessorEnvironment) {
461       // if running at region
462       regionEnv = (RegionCoprocessorEnvironment) env;
463       zk = regionEnv.getRegionServerServices().getZooKeeper();
464     }
465 
466     // If zk is null or IOException while obtaining auth manager,
467     // throw RuntimeException so that the coprocessor is unloaded.
468     if (zk != null) {
469       try {
470         this.authManager = TableAuthManager.get(zk, env.getConfiguration());
471       } catch (IOException ioe) {
472         throw new RuntimeException("Error obtaining TableAuthManager", ioe);
473       }
474     } else {
475       throw new RuntimeException("Error obtaining TableAuthManager, zk found null.");
476     }
477   }

483   @Override
484   public void preCreateTable(ObserverContext<MasterCoprocessorEnvironment> c,
485       HTableDescriptor desc, HRegionInfo[] regions) throws IOException {
486     Set<byte[]> families = desc.getFamiliesKeys();
487     HashMap<byte[], Set<byte[]>> familyMap = Maps.newHashMapWithExpectedSize(families.size());
488     for (byte[] family: families) {
489       familyMap.put(family, null);
490     }
491     requireGlobalPermission("createTable", Permission.Action.CREATE, desc.getName(), familyMap);
492   }
493 
494   @Override
495   public void postCreateTable(ObserverContext<MasterCoprocessorEnvironment> c,
496       HTableDescriptor desc, HRegionInfo[] regions) throws IOException {
497     if (!AccessControlLists.isAclTable(desc)) {
498       String owner = desc.getOwnerString();
499       // default the table owner to current user, if not specified.
500       if (owner == null) owner = getActiveUser().getShortName();
501       UserPermission userperm = new UserPermission(Bytes.toBytes(owner), desc.getName(), null,
502           Action.values());
503       AccessControlLists.addUserPermission(c.getEnvironment().getConfiguration(), userperm);
504     }
505   }

714   @Override
715   public void preOpen(ObserverContext<RegionCoprocessorEnvironment> e) throws IOException {
716     RegionCoprocessorEnvironment env = e.getEnvironment();
717     final HRegion region = env.getRegion();
718     if (region == null) {
719       LOG.error("NULL region from RegionCoprocessorEnvironment in preOpen()");
720       return;
721     } else {
722       HRegionInfo regionInfo = region.getRegionInfo();
723       if (isSpecialTable(regionInfo)) {
724         isSystemOrSuperUser(regionEnv.getConfiguration());
725       } else {
726         requirePermission("open", Action.ADMIN);
727       }
728     }
729   }
730 
731   @Override
732   public void postOpen(ObserverContext<RegionCoprocessorEnvironment> c) {
733     RegionCoprocessorEnvironment env = c.getEnvironment();
734     final HRegion region = env.getRegion();
735     if (region == null) {
736       LOG.error("NULL region from RegionCoprocessorEnvironment in postOpen()");
737       return;
738     }
739     if (AccessControlLists.isAclRegion(region)) {
740       aclRegion = true;
741       try {
742         initialize(env);
743       } catch (IOException ex) {
744         // if we can't obtain permissions, it's better to fail
745         // than perform checks incorrectly
746         throw new RuntimeException("Failed to initialize permissions cache", ex);
747       }
748     }
749   }

782   @Override
783   public void preGet(final ObserverContext<RegionCoprocessorEnvironment> c,
784       final Get get, final List<KeyValue> result) throws IOException {
785     /*
786      if column family level checks fail, check for a qualifier level permission
787      in one of the families.  If it is present, then continue with the AccessControlFilter.
788       */
789     RegionCoprocessorEnvironment e = c.getEnvironment();
790     User requestUser = getActiveUser();
791     AuthResult authResult = permissionGranted("get", requestUser,
792         TablePermission.Action.READ, e, get.getFamilyMap());
793     if (!authResult.isAllowed()) {
794       if (hasFamilyQualifierPermission(requestUser,
795           TablePermission.Action.READ, e, get.getFamilyMap())) {
796         byte[] table = getTableName(e);
797         AccessControlFilter filter = new AccessControlFilter(authManager,
798             requestUser, table);
799 
800         // wrap any existing filter
801         if (get.getFilter() != null) {
802           FilterList wrapper = new FilterList(FilterList.Operator.MUST_PASS_ALL,
803               Lists.newArrayList(filter, get.getFilter()));
804           get.setFilter(wrapper);
805         } else {
806           get.setFilter(filter);
807         }
808         logResult(AuthResult.allow("get", "Access allowed with filter", requestUser,
809             TablePermission.Action.READ, authResult.getTable(), get.getFamilyMap()));
810       } else {
811         logResult(authResult);
812         throw new AccessDeniedException("Insufficient permissions (table=" +
813           e.getRegion().getTableDesc().getNameAsString() + ", action=READ)");
814       }
815     } else {
816       // log auth success
817       logResult(authResult);
818     }
819   }

915   @Override
916   public RegionScanner preScannerOpen(final ObserverContext<RegionCoprocessorEnvironment> c,
917       final Scan scan, final RegionScanner s) throws IOException {
918     /*
919      if column family level checks fail, check for a qualifier level permission
920      in one of the families.  If it is present, then continue with the AccessControlFilter.
921       */
922     RegionCoprocessorEnvironment e = c.getEnvironment();
923     User user = getActiveUser();
924     AuthResult authResult = permissionGranted("scannerOpen", user, TablePermission.Action.READ, e,
925         scan.getFamilyMap());
926     if (!authResult.isAllowed()) {
927       if (hasFamilyQualifierPermission(user, TablePermission.Action.READ, e,
928           scan.getFamilyMap())) {
929         byte[] table = getTableName(e);
930         AccessControlFilter filter = new AccessControlFilter(authManager,
931             user, table);
932 
933         // wrap any existing filter
934         if (scan.hasFilter()) {
935           FilterList wrapper = new FilterList(FilterList.Operator.MUST_PASS_ALL,
936               Lists.newArrayList(filter, scan.getFilter()));
937           scan.setFilter(wrapper);
938         } else {
939           scan.setFilter(filter);
940         }
941         logResult(AuthResult.allow("scannerOpen", "Access allowed with filter", user,
942             TablePermission.Action.READ, authResult.getTable(), scan.getFamilyMap()));
943       } else {
944         // no table/family level perms and no qualifier level perms, reject
945         logResult(authResult);
946         throw new AccessDeniedException("Insufficient permissions for user '"+
947             (user != null ? user.getShortName() : "null")+"' "+
948             "for scanner open on table " + Bytes.toString(getTableName(e)));
949       }
950     } else {
951       // log success
952       logResult(authResult);
953     }
954     return s;
955   }

959       final Scan scan, final RegionScanner s) throws IOException {
960     User user = getActiveUser();

962       scannerOwners.put(s, user.getShortName());
963     }
964     return s;
965   }

988   /**
989    * Verify, when servicing an RPC, that the caller is the scanner owner.
990    * If so, we assume that access control is correctly enforced based on
991    * the checks performed in preScannerOpen()
992    */
993   private void requireScannerOwner(InternalScanner s)
994       throws AccessDeniedException {
995     if (RequestContext.isInRequestContext()) {
996       String requestUserName = RequestContext.getRequestUserName();
997       String owner = scannerOwners.get(s);
998       if (owner != null && !owner.equals(requestUserName)) {
999         throw new AccessDeniedException("User '"+ requestUserName +"' is not the scanner owner!");
1000       }
1001     }
1002   }

1005    * Verifies user has WRITE privileges on
1006    * the Column Families involved in the bulkLoadHFile
1007    * request. Specific Column Write privileges are presently
1008    * ignored.
1009    */
1010   @Override
1011   public void preBulkLoadHFile(ObserverContext<RegionCoprocessorEnvironment> ctx,
1012       List<Pair<byte[], String>> familyPaths) throws IOException {

1014     for(Pair<byte[],String> el : familyPaths) {
1015       requirePermission("preBulkLoadHFile",
1016           ctx.getEnvironment().getRegion().getTableDesc().getName(),
1017           el.getFirst(),
1018           null,
1019           Permission.Action.WRITE);

1023   private AuthResult hasSomeAccess(RegionCoprocessorEnvironment e, String request, Action action) throws IOException {
1024     User requestUser = getActiveUser();
1025     byte[] tableName = e.getRegion().getTableDesc().getName();
1026     AuthResult authResult = permissionGranted(request, requestUser,
1027         action, e, Collections.EMPTY_MAP);
1028     if (!authResult.isAllowed()) {
1029       for(UserPermission userPerm:
1030           AccessControlLists.getUserPermissions(regionEnv.getConfiguration(), tableName)) {
1031         for(Permission.Action userAction: userPerm.getActions()) {
1032           if(userAction.equals(action)) {
1033             return AuthResult.allow(request, "Access allowed", requestUser,
1034                 action, tableName, null, null);
1035           }
1036         }
1037       }
1038     }
1039     return authResult;
1040   }

1073   /* ---- AccessControllerProtocol implementation ---- */
1074   /*
1075    * These methods are only allowed to be called against the _acl_ region(s).
1076    * This will be restricted by both client side and endpoint implementations.
1077    */
1078   @Override
1079   public void grant(UserPermission perm) throws IOException {
1080     // verify it's only running at .acl.
1081     if (aclRegion) {
1082       if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1083         LOG.debug("Received request to grant access permission " + perm.toString());
1084       }
1085 
1086       requirePermission("grant", perm.getTable(), perm.getFamily(), perm.getQualifier(), Action.ADMIN);
1087 
1088       AccessControlLists.addUserPermission(regionEnv.getConfiguration(), perm);
1089       if (AUDITLOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
1090         // audit log should store permission changes in addition to auth results
1091         AUDITLOG.trace("Granted permission " + perm.toString());
1092       }
1093     } else {
1094       throw new CoprocessorException(AccessController.class, "This method "
1095           + "can only execute at " + Bytes.toString(AccessControlLists.ACL_TABLE_NAME) + " table.");
1096     }
1097   }

1104             permission.getFamily(), permission.getQualifier(),
1105             permission.getActions()));

1108   @Override
1109   public void revoke(UserPermission perm) throws IOException {
1110     // only allowed to be called on _acl_ region
1111     if (aclRegion) {
1112       if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1113         LOG.debug("Received request to revoke access permission " + perm.toString());
1114       }
1115 
1116       requirePermission("revoke", perm.getTable(), perm.getFamily(),
1117                         perm.getQualifier(), Action.ADMIN);
1118 
1119       AccessControlLists.removeUserPermission(regionEnv.getConfiguration(), perm);
1120       if (AUDITLOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
1121         // audit log should record all permission changes
1122         AUDITLOG.trace("Revoked permission " + perm.toString());
1123       }
1124     } else {
1125       throw new CoprocessorException(AccessController.class, "This method "
1126           + "can only execute at " + Bytes.toString(AccessControlLists.ACL_TABLE_NAME) + " table.");
1127     }
1128   }

1139   @Override
1140   public List<UserPermission> getUserPermissions(final byte[] tableName) throws IOException {
1141     // only allowed to be called on _acl_ region
1142     if (aclRegion) {
1143       requirePermission("userPermissions", tableName, null, null, Action.ADMIN);
1144 
1145       List<UserPermission> perms = AccessControlLists.getUserPermissions(
1146         regionEnv.getConfiguration(), tableName);
1147       return perms;
1148     } else {
1149       throw new CoprocessorException(AccessController.class, "This method "
1150           + "can only execute at " + Bytes.toString(AccessControlLists.ACL_TABLE_NAME) + " table.");
1151     }
1152   }

1154   @Override
1155   public void checkPermissions(Permission[] permissions) throws IOException {
1156     byte[] tableName = regionEnv.getRegion().getTableDesc().getName();
1157     for (Permission permission : permissions) {
1158       if (permission instanceof TablePermission) {
1159         TablePermission tperm = (TablePermission) permission;
1160         for (Permission.Action action : permission.getActions()) {
1161           if (!Arrays.equals(tperm.getTable(), tableName)) {
1162             throw new CoprocessorException(AccessController.class, String.format("This method "
1163                 + "can only execute at the table specified in TablePermission. " +
1164                 "Table of the region:%s , requested table:%s", Bytes.toString(tableName),
1165                 Bytes.toString(tperm.getTable())));
1166           }
1167 
1168           HashMap<byte[], Set<byte[]>> familyMap = Maps.newHashMapWithExpectedSize(1);
1169           if (tperm.getFamily() != null) {
1170             if (tperm.getQualifier() != null) {
1171               familyMap.put(tperm.getFamily(), Sets.newHashSet(tperm.getQualifier()));
1172             } else {
1173               familyMap.put(tperm.getFamily(), null);
1174             }
1175           }
1176 
1177           requirePermission("checkPermissions", action, regionEnv, familyMap);
1178         }
1179 
1180       } else {
1181         for (Permission.Action action : permission.getActions()) {
1182           requirePermission("checkPermissions", action);
1183         }
1184       }
1185     }
1186   }

1199     throw new HBaseRPC.UnknownProtocolException(
1200         "Unexpected protocol requested: "+protocol);

1203   private byte[] getTableName(RegionCoprocessorEnvironment e) {
1204     HRegion region = e.getRegion();
1205     byte[] tableName = null;
1206 
1207     if (region != null) {
1208       HRegionInfo regionInfo = region.getRegionInfo();
1209       if (regionInfo != null) {
1210         tableName = regionInfo.getTableName();
1211       }
1212     }
1213     return tableName;
1214   }

1216   private Map<byte[], ? extends Collection<byte[]>> makeFamilyMap(byte[] family,
1217       byte[] qualifier) {
1218     if (family == null) {
1219       return null;
1220     }
1221 
1222     Map<byte[], Collection<byte[]>> familyMap = Maps.newHashMapWithExpectedSize(1);
1223     familyMap.put(family, qualifier != null ? ImmutableSet.of(qualifier) : null);
1224     return familyMap;
1225   }

1247   private void isSystemOrSuperUser(Configuration conf) throws IOException {
1248     User user = User.getCurrent();
1249     if (user == null) {
1250       throw new IOException("Unable to obtain the current user, "
1251           + "authorization checks for internal operations will not work correctly!");
1252     }
1253 
1254     String currentUser = user.getShortName();
1255     List<String> superusers = Lists.asList(currentUser,
1256       conf.getStrings(AccessControlLists.SUPERUSER_CONF_KEY, new String[0]));
1257 
1258     User activeUser = getActiveUser();
1259     if (!(superusers.contains(activeUser.getShortName()))) {
1260       throw new AccessDeniedException("User '" + (user != null ? user.getShortName() : "null")
1261           + "is not system or super user.");
1262     }
1263   }
1264 
1265   private boolean isSpecialTable(HRegionInfo regionInfo) {
1266     byte[] tableName = regionInfo.getTableName();
1267     return tableName.equals(AccessControlLists.ACL_TABLE_NAME)
1268       || tableName.equals(Bytes.toBytes("-ROOT-"))
1269       || tableName.equals(Bytes.toBytes(".META."));
1270   }
